abstract: As mortgage companies face troubled times, an investor who made his name turning around distressed companies sees opportunity in the lending business.
snippet: As mortgage companies face troubled times, an investor who made his name turning around distressed companies sees opportunity in the lending business.
lead_paragraph: Wilbur L. Ross Jr., the investor who made his name by successfully buying distressed companies like steel producers, now sees an opportunity in the mortgage business.

headline.main: Investor Known for Turnarounds Looks at Mortgages
